DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Anti-Mullerian Hormone Lab Result Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value measuring the level of anti-mullerian hormone in the blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the result of a laboratory procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for anti-mullerian hormone (a protein that is encoded by the AMH gene and inhibits the development of the MÃ¼llerian ducts).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Anti-Mullerian Hormone Receptor Type II Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: Encoded by human AMHR2 Gene, the 573-amino acid 62.7 kD Anti-Mullerian Hormone Receptor Type II Ser/Thr protein kinase (TGFB Receptor Family) is a type I membrane protein.  Type II receptors bind ligand but require a type I receptor for signal transduction.  Anti-Mullerian Hormone (AMH/MIS/MIF), produced by Sertoli cells, induces regression of Mullerian ducts, which differentiate into the uterus and fallopian tubes.  Type I persistent Mullerian duct syndrome is caused by AMH gene mutation; type II syndrome is due to AMHR mutation.  (OMIM, Swiss-Prot, and NCI):The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Anti-Muellerian hormone type-2 receptor (573 aa, ~63 kDa) is encoded by the human AMHR2 gene. This protein plays a role in signaling, serine/threonine phosphorylation and ligand binding.
